TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PropertyTabAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the property tab or tabs to display for the specified class or classes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The PropertyTabAttribute lets you add a new property page to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> control. The PropertyTabAttribute can add additional property tabs to expose property information other than a component's default set of properties.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the PropertyTabAttribute to specify a property tab. The code example defines a component that exposes the properties of another selected component by type.
[!code-cs[PropertyTabExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.componentmodel._110_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[PropertyTabExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.componentmodel._110_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[PropertyTabExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.componentmodel._110_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is a default constructor that creates an uninitialized <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabAttribute>. This constructor can be used to derive from this attribute and specify multiple tab types by calling <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabAttribute.InitializeArrays%2A>.

Docs.param: The assembly qualified name of the type of tab to create. For an example of this format convention, see <xref:System.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName%2A>.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified tab class name.

Docs.param: The assembly qualified name of the type of tab to create. For an example of this format convention, see <xref:System.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName%2A>.
A that indicates the scope of this tab. If the scope is , it is shown only for components with the corresponding . If it is , it is shown for all components on the document.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified tab class name and tab scope.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified type of tab and tab scope.

.method familyhidebysig instance void InitializeArrays(string[] tabClassNames, valuetype System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabScope[] tabScopes) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of fully qualified type names of the types to create for tabs on the Properties window.
The scope of each tab. If the scope is , it is shown only for components with the corresponding . If it is , it is shown for all components on the document.
Docs.summary: Initializes the attribute using the specified names of tab classes and array of tab scopes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks InitializeArrays provides a utility function that can be used to set the types of tab classes that this <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabAttribute> specifies.

Docs.summary: Gets the types of tabs that this attribute uses.
Docs.value: An array of types indicating the types of tabs that this attribute uses.

remarks.format: ## Remarks All specified types must be able to be assigned to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab>.

Docs.exception: The types specified by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabAttribute.TabClassNames%2A> property could not be found.
